intro: Tirtalia striata, commonly known as the striped tirtalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its strikingly patterned leaves, which feature distinct stripes of varying colors. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental appeal. Tirtalia striata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
